sello.heroSubtitle: A distinction of excellence that recognizes the beauty, heritage and commitment of municipalities that preserve the essence of rural Spain.
sello.criteriaLead: Each candidate village is evaluated according to six fundamental pillars that guarantee its authenticity and quality.
sello.criteria1Desc: Conservation of the urban complex, monuments and traditional buildings of historical value.
sello.criteria2Desc: Cultural legacy, living traditions and intangible elements that define the identity of the people.
sello.criteria3Desc: Harmonious integration with the landscape and respect for the surrounding environment.
sello.criteria4Desc: Resident population, basic services and economic activity that keep the town alive.
sello.criteria5Desc: Conservation, maintenance and development policies compatible with the values of the town.
sello.criteria6Desc: Quality tourism infrastructure and commitment to the traveler's experience.
sello.processBody: The certification process is rigorous and transparent, designed to ensure that only the most exceptional villages receive the label.
sello.step1Desc: The municipality presents its candidacy with documentation on its heritage, history and services.
sello.step2Desc: A committee of experts analyzes compliance with the established criteria.
sello.step3Desc: On-site inspection to check the actual condition of the town and its resources.
sello.step4Desc: The Quality Committee issues its verdict and, if favorable, awards the seal.
sello.aboutBody1: The Most Beautiful Villages of Spain is a non-profit association founded in 2010 by a group of mayors committed to the preservation and promotion of Spain's rural heritage.
sello.aboutBody2: Our mission is to make these exceptional places known, to promote sustainable and respectful tourism, and to support local communities in the conservation of their historical and cultural heritage.
sello.worldLead: We are part of a global network of associations that promote the most beautiful villages in their respective countries.
sello.ctaTitle: Does your municipality want to be part of it?
sello.ctaLead: If you believe that your town meets the requirements to receive the Seal of The Most Beautiful Villages of Spain, we invite you to start the application process.
sello.quickRequestDesc: Start the application process for your municipality.
sello.quickWhoDesc: Meet the team and the history of the association.
sello.cardProcessDesc: Learn about the stages that a municipality must go through from the initial application to the final award of the quality seal.
sello.cardCriteriaDesc: Discover the quality standards in heritage, urban planning, landscape and management that candidate villages must meet.
sello.whoLead: Meet the association that promotes and preserves the heritage of the most beautiful villages in Spain.
sello.whoCtaTitle: Do you want your people to be part of it?
sello.whoCtaBody: Discover the admission process and the criteria to be met by the municipalities that are candidates for the quality seal.
sello.processCtaTitle: Does your town meet the requirements?
sello.processCtaBody: Check the evaluation criteria and find out if your municipality can be part of the network.
sello.criteriaLeadText: Summary of the criteria included in our Quality Charter. Every candidate municipality must meet these requirements to obtain the seal of The Most Beautiful Villages of Spain.
sello.qualityCharterBody: All the detailed criteria, the instruction procedure, the ways of using the mark and the obligations of the member villages are set out in the Quality Charter, the official document governing the association.
sello.uneteForMunicipalitiesBody: If you are a mayor or representative of a municipality and you believe that your town meets the quality criteria, you can start the application process.
sello.uneteStep1Desc: Review the evaluation criteria and the Quality Charter.
sello.uneteStep2Desc: The City Council must formally approve the application.
sello.uneteStep3Desc: Complete the official form with the required documentation.
sello.uneteForPartnersBody: Companies, institutions and organizations can collaborate with the association through different forms of sponsorship and collaboration.
sello.benefitsTitle: Benefits of belonging to the network
sello.benefitsLead: Being part of the Most Beautiful Villages of Spain offers multiple advantages for local development.
sello.benefitVisibilityDesc: Promotion in national and international media and presence at tourism fairs.
sello.benefitTourismDesc: Significant increase in visitors and overnight stays in the municipality.
sello.benefitNetworkDesc: Belonging to the worldwide network of the most beautiful villages with presence in several countries.
sello.benefitEconomicDesc: Boosting the local economy with new business and employment opportunities.
sello.anyQuestionsBody: Our team will be happy to answer any questions you may have about the adhesion process.
sello.sociosLead: Meet the institutions, collaborators and entities that are part of our project.
sello.proximamenteSocios: The association's institutions and collaborators will soon be shown here.
sello.processAdmissionBody: If your municipality wants to apply for the quality seal, please consult the complete admission process and evaluation criteria.
sello.pueblosMiembrosBody: Discover the 126 municipalities that are part of the association and proudly display the seal of quality.
sello.wantToBePartner: Do you want to become a collaborating partner?
sello.wantToBePartnerBody: If your company or organization would like to collaborate with the association, request information about sponsorship and collaboration options.
